body.header: Questions 1-5. Listen to the recording, which will play automatically, and follow the instructions. Write the appropriate letters A-C against Questions 1-5.

ol.li: a growing percentage of old people in the population
greater dependence on private pension funds
family responsibility for the care of the elderly

p.font: 1. The lecturer describes a rise in life expectancy as exciting and a wonderful opportunity. These are very positive adjectives.
2. The lecturer says she sees problems for societies with ageing populations and talks about drawbacks. Drawbacks are disadvantages or problems and so negative.
3. The lecturer says she strongly supports people being able to retire when it suits them, therefore working for longer.
4. The lecturer says that people will have to organise their own pensions but she doesn't say what she thinks about this.
5. The lecturer says it's unlikely that old people will be cared for at home but she doesn't express an opinion on this.

section.p: You should be able to tell from the question and the points given that you will hear someone expressing their opinion on the consequences of an ageing population. Questions 1 - 5You will be unable to predict what the speaker's opinions are but you need to check you know what the A, B and C represent and that you know what to listen out for. Think about other ways of expressing the points as well. For example, 'a rise in life expectancy' could be expressed as 'increase in life expectancy'.
